Detailed Description

Internal base class for OBEX transport interfaces.

Warning;
This is an internal interface and must not be used outside APOXI OBEX at all.

Its purpose is to specify an interface towards the different transport layers used by OBEX. The concept is similar to BSD sockets with the exception that all operations are performed asynchronously. Therefore each port implementation contains a state machine which controls port behaviour. Additionally the class provides common functions used by the derived classes ObexServerPort and ObexClientPort which implement the interface to realize server- and client type ports.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum ObexAbstractPort::EventType
 

Event opcodes for the port's Finite State Machine (fsm).

Enumerator:
FSM_INTERNAL_EVENTS 
EvOpen  Triggers open procedure.
EvClose  Triggers close procedure.
EvOpComplete  OnComplete() was called.
EvResolveComplete  ReturnObexAddress() was called.
EvAvsChanged  Transport's AVS has changed.
EvAvsReady  Transport's AVS is AvsReady.
EvAvsIsBad  Transport's AVS is not AvsReady.
EvResolveSuccess  Address resolution completed successfully.
EvResolveFailure  Address resolution completed with error(s).
EvOpenSuccess  Channel open procedure completed successfully.
EvOpenFailure  Channel open procedure completed with error(s).
EvReleaseComplete  Channel was released.

BOOLEAN ObexAbstractPort::AcceptsMessage (  const ObexAddrMsg &  msg  ) 
 

Try to dispatch an ObexAddrMsg in the context of the port.

When the message type and operation id match that of an operation ongoing for the port, the operation is completed an 'TRUE' is returned. The message may be considered as dispatched then. In any other case, 'FALSE' is returned and dispatching should continue.

BOOLEAN ObexAbstractPort::AcceptsMessage (  const ObexMsg &  msg  ) 
 

Try to dispatch an ObexMsg in the context of the port.

When the message type and operation id match that of an operation ongoing for the port, the operation is completed an 'TRUE' is returned. The message may be considered as dispatched then. In any other case, 'FALSE' is returned and dispatching should continue.

void ObexAbstractPort::CheckTransportAvailable (   ) 
 

Check whether the transport is still available.

Must be called when an ObexTransportMsg is received which affects the transport associated with the port.

void ObexAbstractPort::Close (   ) 
 

Starts the close procedure on the channel.

This launches an asynchronous procedure which is completed by calling OnChannelClosed().
